people.title: Manage Conflict
people.primeDirective: Facilitate, don’t dictate. Resolve at the source.
people.deepDive: PMI views conflict as an opportunity for growth. Distinguish between 'Functional' (task-based) and 'Dysfunctional' (person-based) conflict.
people.veteranTip: In my 16 years, I've found that technical 'disagreements' are often just lack of role clarity. Check the RACI first—half the time, the conflict disappears once everyone knows who actually owns the decision.

learnMore.logic: IF the conflict is about technical approach, THEN use 'Collaborating'. IF it's a personality clash, THEN refer to the 'Team Charter'.
learnMore.mindsetTip: Always 'Assess' first. Never 'Forcing' a decision on the exam.

people.title: Lead a Team
people.primeDirective: Servant Leadership: You are the blocker-remover.
people.deepDive: Adopt a situational leadership style based on the team's maturity level using Tuckman's Model.
people.veteranTip: Don't fall into the 'Expert Trap.' Your job isn't to be the smartest person in the room; it's to make the room smart enough to solve the problem.

learnMore.logic: IF the team is in 'Storming', focus on ground rules. IF 'Performing', move to a delegating style.
learnMore.mindsetTip: The PM is a facilitator. Any answer where the PM 'commands' is usually a trap.

process.title: Execute with Urgency
process.deepDive: Balance speed with quality. Use Minimum Viable Product (MVP) thinking.
process.veteranTip: Urgency doesn't mean 'hurry.' It means 'prioritization.' Move fast on the right things—the Critical Path.

learnMore.logic: IF a delay occurs, THEN assess the impact on the Critical Path before crashing the schedule.
learnMore.mindsetTip: Focus on delivering the 'Business Value' first.

process.title: Manage Budget
process.primeDirective: Baseline early, track often with EVM.
process.deepDive: Control costs using Earned Value Management (EVM) metrics like CPI and SPI.
process.veteranTip: Budgeting is about transparency. If you're 20% over, tell the sponsor why and show the recovery plan immediately.

learnMore.logic: IF CPI < 1.0, THEN analyze root cause and update the Risk Register.
learnMore.mindsetTip: Protect the baseline, but manage the reality of the variance.

business.title: Manage Compliance
business.deepDive: Integrate audits and quality checks into the project schedule from day one.
business.veteranTip: I treat compliance as a 'Gate.' If it doesn't pass, we don't move. It saves millions in rework and legal fees later.

learnMore.logic: IF regulations change mid-project, THEN submit a Change Request to assess the impact.
learnMore.mindsetTip: Compliance is a risk you cannot 'Accept'; you must 'Mitigate' or 'Avoid'.

formulas.name: CPI (Cost Performance Index)
formulas.scenario: EV is $200,000, but the team has already spent (AC) $250,000.
formulas.veteranInsight: Spending $1 to get $0.80 of value is a systemic failure. Check for scope creep.

quizPool.question: A senior developer on your team is consistently missing deadlines. They admit they are overwhelmed by the new architecture. What is your NEXT move?

options.text: Reassign their tasks to a faster developer.
Schedule a training session for the developer and assess progress.
options.feedback: Surgical: PMP prioritizes Empowerment and Training.

quizPool.veteranLogic: Invest in the person, not just the task. Build a self-sustaining team.

mockExam.question: A project is experiencing significant delays due to a vendor dispute. The contract is Fixed-Price. What should the Project Manager do first?
options: Issue a formal notice of default.
